metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1684 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
numbers.c in libxslt before 1.1.29, as used in Google Chrome before 51.0.2704.63, mishandles the i format token for xsl:number data, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (integer overflow or resource consumption) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted document.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1684` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-browser-l10n - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-chromedriver - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
No subscription required

libxslt1.1 - 1.1.28-2.1ubuntu0.1
python-libxslt1 - 1.1.28-2.1ubuntu0.1
xsltproc - 1.1.28-2.1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242').
libxslt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.28-2.1ubuntu0.1').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.15.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
